chart_metadata.name: frigate
chart_metadata.description: Frigate is an NVR With Realtime Object Detection for IP Cameras

runAsContext.description: Frigate runs as root user. When USB Bus is mounted, it is able to escalate privileges.

capabilities.name: CHOWN
capabilities.description: Frigate is able to chown files.

capabilities.name: FOWNER
capabilities.description: Frigate are able to bypass permission checks for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: DAC_OVERRIDE
capabilities.description: Frigate is able to bypass permission checks.

capabilities.name: SETGID
capabilities.description: Frigate is able to set group ID for it's sub-processes.

capabilities.name: SETUID
capabilities.description: Frigate is able to set user ID for it's sub-processes.

attrs.label: Image
attrs.description: The image to use for Frigate.

attrs.label: Mount USB Bus
attrs.description:
Mount the USB bus to the container.</br>
This is required if you want to use USB devices, like Coral</br>
This will mount the USB bus to /dev/bus/usb inside the container.

attrs.label: Additional Environment Variables
attrs.description: Configure additional environment variables for Frigate.

attrs.label: Host Network
attrs.description: Bind to the host network. It's recommended to keep this disabled.</br>

subquestions.label: Web Port
subquestions.description:
The port for the Frigate Web UI.</br>
Internal port: 5000

subquestions.label: RTMP Port
subquestions.description:
The RTMP port for Frigate.</br>
Internal port: 1935

subquestions.label: RTSP Port
subquestions.description:
The RTSP port for Frigate.</br>
Internal port: 8554

subquestions.label: WebRTC Port
subquestions.description:
The WebRTC port for Frigate.</br>
Internal port: 8555</br>
Applies to both TCP and UDP.

attrs.label: Frigate Config Storage
attrs.description: The path to store Frigate Configuration.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)

attrs.description: The configuration for the ixVolume dataset.

attrs.label: Enable ACL
attrs.description: Enable ACL for the dataset.

attrs.label: Dataset Name
attrs.description: The name of the dataset to use for storage.

attrs.description: Path to perform ACL

attrs.description: The host path to use for storage.

attrs.description: The path to store Frigate Media.

https://docs.frigate.video/frigate/installation/#calculating-required-shm-size

attrs.label: Additional Storage
attrs.description: Additional storage for Frigate.

attrs.label: Type
attrs.description:
ixVolume: Is dataset created automatically by the system.</br>
Host Path: Is a path that already exists on the system.</br>
SMB Share: Is a SMB share that is mounted to a persistent volume claim.

enum.description: Host Path (Path that already exists on the system)
ixVolume (Dataset created automatically by the system)
SMB Share (Mounts a persistent volume claim to a SMB share)

attrs.label: Size (in Gi)
attrs.description: The size of the volume quota.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: CPU limit for Frigate.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid CPU limit formats are</br>
- Plain Integer - eg. 1</br>
- Float - eg. 0.5</br>
- Milicpu - eg. 500m

attrs.label: Memory
attrs.description: Memory limit for Frigate.

schema.valid_chars_error:
Valid Memory limit formats are</br>
- Suffixed with E/P/T/G/M/K - eg. 1G</br>
- Suffixed with Ei/Pi/Ti/Gi/Mi/Ki - eg. 1Gi</br>
- Plain Integer in bytes - eg. 1024</br>
- Exponent - eg. 134e6

1.2.4.app_readme:
Frigate

Frigate is an NVR With Realtime Object Detection for IP Cameras

Note: m.2 Coral TPU devices is not supported.
1.2.4.detailed_readme:
Frigate

Frigate is an NVR With Realtime Object Detection for IP Cameras

Note: m.2 Coral TPU devices is not supported.
